body: Hey all,  I'm running into a problem where if two surfaces with windows facing each other, will not correctly define their boundary conditions after passing through the the solve adjacency component. What is happening is that the wall or parent surface boundary condition is changed to "SURFACE" while the window or child surface remains "Outdoors". Which is causing the energy simulation to quit, like so:  [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/NSP30zoaI8KHrjaCKWmLFM3fNq4d-cgeC3jzXscLzqCLJuUDqLPr6xSGEaOGk-XsLDlH1AjsElqaB5uXIHHPz-7DDuiJgdRt/adj_error.PNG)  I tried to track the down the error in the solve adjacency component - at the updateAdj(...) function the BCs the childsurfaces are failing the condition check for childSurface2.BCObject.name == "" and then aren't updated. But I have no idea how to fix this (assuming it's even the correct error!).  [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/NSP30zoaI8JVI9YY8AsYpJ1ciOW8Zf1w5bQcRqPxvDEijo4QtsHSVez5hbwFfuUr8eyetIEXC7FywXcwD0M9PmtviKPT2F48/adj_error2.PNG) What do you guys think? Attached is a simple model where I've reproduced the error.
topic: E+ error due to mismatched boundary conditions for adjacent surfaces
